H0.text: Latin 'collum' refers to which part of the human body. Shoulder

H1.text: Latin 'collum' refers to which part of the human body. Throat

H2.text: Latin 'collum' refers to which part of the human body. Chest

H3.text: Latin 'collum' refers to which part of the human body. Neck

A4.text: The cervical vertebrae are the smallest of the true vertebrae and can be readily distinguished from those of the thoracic or lumbar regions by the presence of a transverse foramen, an opening in each transverse process, through which the vertebral artery, vertebral veins, and inferior cervical ganglion pass.
